title.$t: DevTools: Sources indentation setting is not working.

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_3) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.118 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
Select a chunk of code in the editor. Try indenting/outdenting with TAB and SHIFT-TAB.

What is the expected behavior?
If you've selected e.g. "2 Spaces" as default indentation, it should be shifting everything by 2 spaces to the left or right.

What went wrong?
It shifts it by 8, regardless of the setting in preferences.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.118  Channel: stable
OS Version: OS X 10.10.3
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

title.$t: Please deprecate chrome://omnibox.

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/42.0.2311.82 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open chrome://omnibox.

What is the expected behavior?
chrome://omnibox does not exist.

What went wrong?
chrome://omnibox exists. It is a very basic page that needs to be deprecated.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 42.0.2311.82  Channel: beta
OS Version: 6.3
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

chrome://omnibox is practically useless now. Nobody really uses it. Nowadays the omnibox itself is smarter than chrome://omnibox (with flags like Answers in Suggest enabled).

title.$t: Developer console copy css path returns invalid element

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_0) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.118 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Go to https://twitter.com/
2. Open developer console.
3. Find this element "#abuse-harassment-control > div"
4. Copy the css path for the element.
5. Click console and execute document.querySelectorAll(<Copied Css Path>), it returns multiple elements.

What is the expected behavior?
It should return the particular element only.

What went wrong?
I don't know but it happened for some elements only.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.118  Channel: stable
OS Version: OS X 10.10.0
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

title.$t: no google access

content.$t:
Device name: samsung galaxy note 2 

bug description: no access to any google services saying unable to connect to server every google service is unable to connect but internet works fine without google

Had to root my phone to fix this error i was unable to connect to google play or sync my account there was no reason as to why this happened it just did i searched everywhere there was no fix online

Solution: after a full root i downloaded a file browser accessed File system root then etc and edited host file

From this
127.0.0.1   localhost
127.115.145.233	android.clients.google.com mtalk.google.com

to this
127.0.0.1  localhost
# 127.115.145.233	android.clients.google.com mtalk.google.com

clearly a problem that no tech savvy person could fix so i think this needs attention i submitted this under the bug bounty because it is a bug thats happening alot and no one has came up with a fix other than this and without the fix it does render an android useless unless you fully root your device

title.$t: WebRTC crashes when using VP9 encoder

content.$t:
To repro, launch chrome with --enable-webrtc-vp9-support flag. 

Run apprtc.appspot.com/?debug=loopback

The corresponding bug from webrtc is https://code.google.com/p/webrtc/issues/detail?id=4511, which has been landed with position 324411 into chromium.

title.$t: Flash: Hardware acceleration degraded performance for video playback

content.$t: Chrome Version : 41.0.2272.118 (Official Build) m URLs (if applicable) : http://flash.flowplayer.org/demos/configuration/accelerated.html Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Firefox 37: OK IE 7/8/9/10: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Try playing the video with Flash hardware acceleration enabled 2. Go full screen on a high-resolution screen 1920x1080 and greater What is the expected result? Smooth playback (24-30fps minimum?) What happens instead? Jittery playback, seeing 8-9fps on the average with the fps counter turned on. This seems to be specific to the Pepper Flash plugin, disabling the Pepper plugin (as indicated here https://helpx.adobe.com/flash-player/kb/enable-system-flash-player-google-chrome.html) results in smooth playback in fullscreen (2560x1440) Flash version is 17.0.0.134 for Pepper & NPAPI plugins

1. open old chromebook 
2. immediately start changing settings while chrome is initially trying to sync (begin uninstalling apps, changing advanced settings, enabling plugins, changing extensions)

What is the expected behavior?
nothing good

What went wrong?
hell hath no fury

Did this work before? No 

Chrome version:   Channel: n/a
OS Version: 
Flash Version: 

So many many many things go wrong when changing synced items while old items are syncing... what's the rush?  Please just pause all UI access to settings until Chromebook boots up and Chrome OS finishes it's initial sync.

title.$t: CQ master submits all changes using PartialSubmit when BinhostTest fails

content.$t:
When BinhostTest fails on the CQ master (or probably any other stage), the CQ master submits all changes anyway. This is a bug.

Example: http://chromegw.corp.google.com/i/chromeos/builders/CQ%20master/builds/5268

title.$t: Stumpy shows no Media related histograms

content.$t: Version: 43.0.2357.10/6946.4.0 dev on Stumpy OS: ChromeOS What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to chrome://histograms 2. In the monitor where the device Stumpy is hooked up, check for the values as follows: Media.RTCVideoDecoderinitDecodeSuccess = 1 for successful HW Decode Media.RTCVideoEncoderinitEncodeSuccess = 11 (for VP8) and 1 for H264 Media.RTCVideoEncoderProfile = 1 for successful HW Encode" What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The values should be present. But instead i don't see any of the above mentioned histograms' details. Please use labels and text to provide additional information. title.$t: ARC: L-Rebase: Mod dropped -- Native Activity loading and freeing.

content.$t:
Under KK we have a mod:

  mods/android/frameworks/base/core/jni/android_app_NativeActivity.cpp

It intercepts a handful of calls and delegates work to NDK translation for loading and freeing the native code.

This mod does not exist in the L branch, 

This functionality may have been replaced by hooking into the ART native bridge interface, using:

  mods/android/art/runtime/runtime.cc
  src/ndk_translation/native_bridge.cc

To be safe I'm filing this bug to confirm that this indeed is why it was no longer necessary. Or if it turns out we do need it, then it should be simple to re-apply the mod.

title.$t: Add an audio bvt test to verify common cras scenarios

content.$t:
Recently we noticed many audio dev blocker issues due to cras crashes just during system boot, UI boot, or playing audio for the first time.

Issue 474226, Issue 474697, Issue 475292

Let's write a test to verify below sanity tests. We will promote this test to bvt-cq later so any severe regression can be caught at the CQ level.

- verify cras crashes at boot.
- verify cras crashes during opening audio/video steeam (multiple formats).
- verify cras crashes while closing active streams.
- verify number of active streams during playback.
- verify cras PID during playback to make sure crash isn't crashing.

title.$t: Regression: Able to create the supervised user with the same name, and in other case it is not able to create if the 'same user name' is already existing.

content.$t: Chrome Version : 43.0.2357.11 (Official Build) 9629595c746c21f59912fbc5156ef44f32c90f3d-refs/branch-heads/2357@{#36} (32/ 64-bit) OS : All (Aero enabled) Precondition: 'Sign in' to chrome with the valid credentials, which doesn't have any supervised user created previously. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1) Launch chrome, navigate to 'chrome://settings/', click on 'Add person' button from 'People' section, click on 'Control & view the websites' checkbox, enter some name say 'test' and create 'Supervised user'. 2) Again do the same steps to create another supervised user with the same name and observe. What is the expected result? 1) Once we type the same name into 'Name' field to create the 'Supervised user', the error message 'Whoops, this name is already in use!' should occur (Please refer the expected_video), and 'Add' button should became disable or 2) According to the revision r310112, from now if we are able to create the multiple 'Supervised user' with the same name then if we delete the 'already existing supervised user' which has the same name from 'People' section (please refer the actual_video) and try to create the 'supervised user' with the same name it should be allow to create and the message 'Looks like you're already managing a user by that name.' should not be display and should not ask for 'importing user'. What happens instead? Able to create the supervised user with the same name, and in other case it is not able to create if the 'same user name' is already existing. This is a Regression issue broken in 'M-41' and below is the bisect info: Narrow bisect info: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/c326dd5aa4f62e44e97350248dbb1ebaf684af68..5a1c8035967936fe590391a5068f9c91bc2a7fc8?pretty=fuller&n=50 Suspecting:r310112 ?

title.$t: Major vendor certificates violating 39 month validity limit, triggers NET::ERR_CERT_VALIDITY_TOO_LONG error

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/42.0.2311.68 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Visit https://tasks.molomby.com/ (in Chrome 42 or later)

What is the expected behavior?
Site loads with a happy green padlock.

What went wrong?
An error screen is shown:

"Your connection is not private

Attackers might be trying to steal your information from tasks.molomby.com (for example, passwords, messages, or credit cards). NET::ERR_CERT_VALIDITY_TOO_LONG

You attempted to reach tasks.molomby.com, but the server presented a certificate whose validity period is too long to be trustworthy."

The padlock icon is crossed out. Clicking it yields: 

"The server certificate has a validity period that is too long."

Did this work before? Yes Version 41 and earlier accept certs with long validity periods; limit is due to new guidelines

Chrome version: 42.0.2311.68  Channel: n/a
OS Version: 6.1 (Windows 7, Windows Server 2008 R2)
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

The certificate currently installed on https://tasks.molomby.com was reissued a few days ago by RapidSSL (via ssls.com). It's validity period is 2015-04-07 08:57:25 GMT to 2018-07-09 07:00:18 GMT (about 39 months + 2 days).

Earlier this year changes were made to Chrome to bring it into line with the latest CA/Browser Forum guidelines (https://cabforum.org/wp-content/uploads/BRv1.2.3.pdf), which state:

> CAs SHALL NOT issue certificates with validity periods longer than 39 months.

The relevant commit, as far as I can tell, is here..

  https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/4867d6cc021aca57e5a327b7ca8ed365485c0caa

Specifically, the HasTooLongValidity() function, lines 626-670 in /net/cert/cert_verify_proc.cc.

Although this is clearly a problem with the CA, in correspondence with me they've declined to address the issue..

> .. we could not find any official information as to major browsers marking certificates with 39+ months validity as insecure.

> .. hopefully it will be fixed by Google in the next stable version release.

Blah blah etc.

So RapidSSL are in violation of the CA/B guidelines but they're a fairly large CA (owned by GeoTrust/Verisign/Symantec whatever). Given how many users may be affected, is there no room for leniency in the implementation?

I've been unable to find any official recommendations on how "months" should be calculated with regards to validity periods. It's possible other CA's will also calculate 39 months "differently" while Chromes interpretation is quite strict.

Related issues?

* https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=102949
* https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=119213

title.$t: chrome://bookmarks was recently enhanced, but chrome://downloads was not enhanced.

UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/42.0.2311.82 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Open chrome://bookmarks.
2. Open chrome://downloads.

What is the expected behavior?
The bookmarks manager was recently enhanced, now the downloads manager should be enhanced.

What went wrong?
The downloads manager was not enhanced.

Did this work before? N/A 

Chrome version: 42.0.2311.82  Channel: beta
OS Version: 6.3
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

The downloads manager is the same UI concept as the old bookmark manager. If the old bookmark manager should be enhanced to the new bookmarks manager, why not the same with the downloads manager?

title.$t: Please make Linux perf bots GPU capable

content.$t:
It looks like all of the Linux Perf bots on this waterfall:

http://build.chromium.org/p/chromium.perf/builders

specifically:

http://build.chromium.org/p/chromium.perf/builders/Linux%20Perf%20%281%29
http://build.chromium.org/p/chromium.perf/builders/Linux%20Perf%20%282%29
http://build.chromium.org/p/chromium.perf/builders/Linux%20Perf%20%283%29
http://build.chromium.org/p/chromium.perf/builders/Linux%20Perf%20%284%29
http://build.chromium.org/p/chromium.perf/builders/Linux%20Perf%20%285%29

(build{99,100,101,102,103}-a1)

contain NVIDIA GPUs, but are running inside a VMWare container. Here is an excerpt from the stdout of any of the test steps:

INFO:root:OS: linux precise
INFO:root:GPU device 0: VENDOR = 0x10de (Nvidia), DEVICE = 0x104a
INFO:root:GPU Attributes:
INFO:root:  adapter_luid        : 0.0
INFO:root:  amd_switchable      : False
INFO:root:  basic_info_state    : 1
INFO:root:  can_lose_context    : False
INFO:root:  context_info_state  : 2
INFO:root:  direct_rendering    : False
INFO:root:  gl_renderer         : Gallium 0.4 on llvmpipe (LLVM 0x300)
INFO:root:  gl_reset_notification_strategy: 0
INFO:root:  gl_vendor           : VMware, Inc.
INFO:root:  gl_version          : 1.4 (2.1 Mesa 8.0.4)

What is the current configuration of these machines?

If they are physical hardware, would it be possible to run them in that configuration? Specifically, it would be extremely useful if we could remove any VMWare containers, install NVIDIA's proprietary driver, and hook them up to a Raritan. This would enable GPU tests like smoothness.tough_webgl_cases to run on these machines.

title.$t: Displaying and collecting passwords.

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.118 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1.Open any page with a password.
2. Right click the password field and inspect the element and change it's type to text with auto complete on.
3. If the the page has the password saved, it will now appear. If not then a simple click on the input box should reveal the options, If there is nothing then simply leaving the page open until someone uses it will then store the password to later be discovered.

What is the expected behavior?
To not display passwords and sensitive information

What went wrong?
Passwords can be displayed and collected

Did this work before? Yes 4/9/2015

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.118  Channel: stable
OS Version: 6.3
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

This simple vulnerability would be useful if the password is saved on a computer to allow them to view it then use it to change the password if the password isn't there and no options appear then this would be exploitable for those who are patience. For some school systems using online grade programs a student need only change the code once and the password is stored. Then one more access to the computer and the password will now appear as an option for the the student to click and view. This same scheme is more likely used by con-men who get access to a computer as a "repairman" or any repair man waiting to make a quick buck by doing this to a bank webpage. Also anyone who can remotely access a computer then can change it and once the password it used and saved then take it for their own use.

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_10_1) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.118 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. Not a bug with Chrome itself, no known steps
2. 
3. 

What is the expected behavior?
The /Contents/Version folder is supposed to have 2 entries

What went wrong?
A user's startup disk was full. A scan of the drive indicated Google Chrome.app being 8 gigs. Drilling down into the /Contents/Versions folder revealed versions going back to 22. It was 8 gigs. 

Did this work before? N/A

title.$t: reimage 2 lab devices

content.$t:
We have 2 lab devices down in the lab. Both systems ran the same job before they went down.

reinstall_chromeos1-shelf3-host3
reinstall_chromeos1-row3-rack9-host3

In the case of shelf3-host3, the device now has an image that has demo mode on it.
This means that the device does no longer has a working ethernet connection.

In the case of row3-rack9-host3, it no longer had a working ethernet connection as well.

I have reimaged both systems with a TOT image. They are now both running tests.

title.$t: Custom configured APN doesn't persist after reboot

content.$t:
Version: 41

Description (directly from Enterprise customer experiencing the issue):
We are attempting to use optimized 3G sim cards (provided by tracline) in our chromebooks to give connectivity when there is no wifi connection available.
These sim cards, despite using the three network, require an amendment to the Access Point Name information in mobile settings to gain access (see screenshots 1, 2, 3 and 4)
This manually entered Access Point Name information is being lost when the chromebook is re-booted (screenshot 5)
This holds true regardless of whether or not the chromebook is using the public_user account.
We have found that this is not the case with a normal 3G sim card provided by EE as it uses the pre-existing t-mobile APN information (screenshot 6) (I presume from this that the chromebook stores APN information for the main providers e.g. t-mobile, 02, three etc)

Screenshot 1 - https://screenshot.googleplex.com/5gnZ7tuUjc
Screenshot 2 - https://screenshot.googleplex.com/TOhtXCQR2q
Screenshot 3 - https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8wscWFSUXf
Screenshot 4 - https://screenshot.googleplex.com/LRwjX1i1ro
Screenshot 5 - https://screenshot.googleplex.com/r3qQJHMwr1
Screenshot 6 - https://screenshot.googleplex.com/Bx4rikfEg8


I've attached the debug logs from the customer. I'm seeing the following in the logs:

2015-03-20T15:49:01.108290+00:00 shill[1725]: [INFO:mobile_operator_info_impl.cc(109)] Successfully loaded database: /usr/share/shill/serviceproviders.pbf
2015-03-20T15:49:01.193893+00:00 shill[1725]: last message repeated 2 times
2015-03-20T15:49:01.193629+00:00 shill[1725]: [INFO:device.cc(1471)] Already in desired enable state.
2015-03-20T15:49:01.200543+00:00 shill[1725]: [INFO:mobile_operator_info_impl.cc(330)] Operator name [3 UK] (Normalized: [3uk]) does not match any MNO.

So it seems like we have a couple routes here:

1) Get this provider added to the serviceproviders.pbf
2) Add manual APN configuration information to the user shill profile so that it persists on reboot

The customer also says that they use public session and would like this information to persist but I'm not sure how feasible that would be. 

Seems like the easiest solution might be #1.

"""

https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=141570

title.$t: ValueStoreFrontend::Backend::Init doing unexpected I/O early in startup

content.$t:
Version: 43
OS: all

ValueStoreFrontend::Backend::Init shows up as an explicitly traced event in the UMA profiler data. On average it appears to take 425ms which is a bit surprising, as all it does is set:
   db_path_ = db_path;
    storage_ = new LeveldbValueStore(db_path);

The constructor for LeveldbValueStore claims it doesn't actually open the database (until some read/write operation happens). See leveldb_value_store.h:21

-however-

In the constructor, (leveldb_value_store.cc:55) the database is opened.

It seems like on average this initialization is taking ~450ms, and I have no idea what it blocks or if it's needed at that point in time. I haven't yet dug in to see if it's just waiting 450ms due to contention on the File thread or if it's spending time actually doing LevelDB-stuff.

Can the file opening be delayed until later? (or does this not actually matter because it's used immediately?)

title.$t: CL quietly fails PreCQ with no notification.

content.$t:
This CL:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/#/c/264938/

Was marked ready for the CQ.

The PreCQ launcher picked it up and submitted it for testing:

@@@STEP_LINK@testing | platform2 | cmasone:264938:18dcb198@https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/#/c/264938/@@@
09:21:50: INFO: RunCommand: cbuildbot --remote gizmo-pre-cq --timeout 14400 -g 264938 in /mnt/data/b/cbuild/internal_master
Verifying patches...
Submitting tryjob...
Tryjob submitted!
Go to https://uberchromegw.corp.google.com/i/chromiumos.tryserver/waterfall?committer=chrome-bot@chromium.org&builder=gizmo-pre-cq to view the status of your job.
09:22:00: INFO: Running cidb query on pid 718, repr(query) starts with <sqlalchemy.sql.expression.Insert object at 0x7f3f28284f10>

However, the CL was not annotated with this information.

The tryjob died in the cbuildbot bootstrap phase because of a network issue (crbug.com/):

https://uberchromegw.corp.google.com/i/chromiumos.tryserver/builders/gizmo-pre-cq/builds/158

The PreCQ launcher never noticed the failure, and kept logging that the CL was being verified, and kept doing so long after the tryjob had failed (tryjob ended at 09:36:02 2015).

09:43:47: INFO: CLs currently being verified: CL:264938

title.$t: crosh: set_wake_on_lan script does not enable wake on lan

content.$t:
Currently, the set_wake_on_lan script sets the |is_wake_on_lan_enabled_| variable in shill's manager, but this variable does not actually turn wake on LAN on or off.

We should either remove this script, or have it actually turn wake on LAN on/off.

title.$t: With Freon(?), no progress bar on devmode transition

content.$t:
I just picked up a new minnie DVT, and when switching it into devmode there is no longer a progress bar at the top. I suspect it disappeared with the transition to freon?

It's a pretty bad user experience, since the machine just sits there and tells you not to touch it for 10 minutes, with no indication of whether things are actually working/progressing or not.

Release in this case was R43.

[Flagging this as installer, I don't know what's appropriate for freon]

title.$t: Crashes Daily

content.$t:
UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_9_4) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/41.0.2272.118 Safari/537.36

Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. I open Chrome, have multiple tabs open, multiple windows, also different profiles, plus running aside Chrome Canary, and sometimes Chromium.
2. I usually leave it running while putting my computer to sleep (though it doesnt have to be asleep in order to reproduce.
3. Then wake it up (if asleep) and find out all windows of Chrome are closed and the application is not running. Though Chrome Canary is still running and right where I left it.
4. It has done this while using it before, though I do not recall anything in particular that I was doing that differs from typical usage. Usually other Google services (gmail, docs, etc) plus work related stuff (I'm a web dev) maybe listening to some music. Do all the same things on other macs and never experienced this issue.

What is the expected behavior?
That it continues running until I close it.

What went wrong?
It closes all instances of Chrome without me closing it. 

Crashed report ID: 1d6b7e1a4a2b7a3b

How much crashed? Whole browser

Is it a problem with a plugin? N/A 

Did this work before? Yes a few months back

Chrome version: 41.0.2272.118  Channel: stable
OS Version: OS X 10.9.4
Flash Version: Shockwave Flash 17.0 r0

* I have many web development tools, extensions, add ons, etc. If you have questions about the details of these please let me know. But it's a lot to list.
* I have tried toggling on and off many of these and even deleting some, does not seem to have any impact. It still crashes/closes every day like clockwork.
* This problem also occurs when only Chrome (not Canary or Chromium) is running and very lightly, e.g. 1 window, 1 profile, 5 tabs or less.
* I have no issues with other Mac OSX computers running Chrome under all the same circumstances, e.g. multiple windows, profiles, tabs, other instances or chrome, etc.
* It is always up to date because it closes every day like clock work, usually around early morning time, so upon opening of chrome it updates.
* The machine it occurs on is a G5 Power Mac with dual Intel processors and about 32G of RAM. Should be more than enough to handle it, and has for some time prior to this issue.
* First started noticing this happen about a couple of months ago (didn't track the exact date) when I went back to two step auth and activated a second profile. Not 100% sure they are related or that the issue started exactly at the same time, but thought it might be worth mentioning.
* Aside from this issue, there are no other known issue with the machine itself.

Hope this helps with trouble shooting the issue. If this is more information I can provide in order to determine the cause of the issue I am more than happy to provide more details.

title.$t: Unwanted hand pointer is seen for blocked plugin icon inside "Manage Plugin" bubble.

content.$t: Chrome Version: 43.0.2357.10 (Official Build) dev, 8d9c8f3b12cad9ca6b4b4876f1e1898fb341918a-refs/branch-heads/2357@{#28}-32/64 bit. OS: Windows (Win 7-Aero enabled), Linux Test PDF: http://www.ibis-sevilla.es/media/389390/test-flyer.pdf What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Launch chrome, go to 'chrome://settings/content' and set 'Let me choose when to run plugin content' option for Plug-ins. 2. Now open any PDF file or above URL and click on the blocked plugin icon in omnibox 3. Mouse hover on blocked plugin icon inside the bubble and observe Unwanted hand pointer is seen for blocked plugin icon inside "Manage Plugin" bubble. Unwanted hand pointer should not be seen for blocked plugin icon inside "Manage Plugin" bubble. This is an regression issue, broken in M-43 series and below is the narrow bisect info. https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/0c9b968d2dde13e5f01b200f3c9f220a8fdabd93..dc4d8688467495afd4716875e15e3cbee5cd710d?pretty=fuller&n=30 Suspecting - r322295 Note: This issue is not seen on Mac OS.

title.$t: In chrome://apps, text continuation is not seen for App info option in app context menu.

content.$t: Version: 43.0.2357.10 (Official Build) dev Revision 8d9c8f3b12cad9ca6b4b4876f1e1898fb341918a-refs/branch-heads/2357@{#28} (32/64-bit) OS: Linux, Windows (Win 7-Aero enabled) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1) Launch chrome, go to 'chrome://apps', right click on any app and observe 'App info' option. Text continuation is not seen for 'App info' in App context menu. Text continuation should be seen for 'App info' as it opens in a dialog box. This is a Non-Regression issue seen from M-43 series (Chrome version: 43.0.2316.0) i.e r318163. Note: Issue not seen on Mac OS.
